result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas John Gillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas John Gillis

defendant.name: Gillis, Thomas John

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 30 days to be served straight time - the balance can be with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program - with 2 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.  Court allows probation can be transferred to Arizona.  

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) no illegally controlled substances or prescription drugs without a valid prescription; 3) no contact with Boston Store.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 10-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant;
- defendant to have no contact with Boston Store during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping;
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Thomas John Gillis in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 15.  

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders cases 13cm2699 and 14cm779 dismissed and read-n for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Thomas John Gillis in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has pending misdemeanor cases in a different branch.  Court does not object to accepting the pending misdemeanor cases for a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-30-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Defedant not to be possession of any illegal drugs.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Thomas John Gillis in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Authorization of Attorney and Letter from Decision Point Center received and filed.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 8-19-2014, at 1:30 pm. Rm. 221, out of custody court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Thomas John Gillis not in court.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/20/14 @ 1:30pm
